article_title: Proposed soda tax would kill jobs, business advocates say

article_metadata.description: A measure aimed at curbing obesity and boosting funding for Medicaid and other wellness programs would kill jobs the state desperately needs, an opponent of the legislation said Wednesday.Brian Rainville, spokesman for Teamsters Joint Council 25, said the new tax would cut good, middle-class jobs that both Gov. Pat Quinn and President Barack Obama have said are key to economic recovery.These taxes are about reducing consumption, Rainville said. And reducing
article_metadata.author: Tobias Wall State Capitol Bureau
